rejected.text: Every rejection is redirection to something better.
They didn't reject you, {name}. They rejected their chance to work with someone great.
A 'no' today doesn't mean 'no' forever. It means 'not this one.'
I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
rejected.author: Thomas Edison

rejected.text: The right company will see your worth, {name}. This one just wasn't it.
Every successful person has a collection of rejection letters. You're building yours.
Their loss. Literally.
You weren't rejected. You were redirected.
Rejection is simply a redirection to something better.
I was rejected 12 times before getting my first publishing deal.
rejected.author: J.K. Rowling

rejected.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
rejected.author: Winston Churchill

rejected.text: The master has failed more times than the beginner has even tried.
rejected.author: Stephen McCranie

rejected.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
rejected.author: Wayne Gretzky

rejected.text: Plot twist: that rejection just saved you from a toxic workplace.
Rejection is God's protection, {name}.
They said no. The universe said 'I have better plans.'
One day you'll thank this company for not hiring you.
That rejection email? Future you calls it 'the best thing that ever happened.'
Fall seven times, stand up eight.
rejected.author: Japanese Proverb

rejected.text: Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.
rejected.author: J.K. Rowling

rejected.text: If you're not failing, you're not trying hard enough.
Every 'no' gets you closer to a 'yes.'
The rejection hotline called. They want their overachievers back.
Collect rejections like Pokémon. Gotta catch 'em all before you catch success.
Rejection: when the trash takes itself out.
Being rejected by a clown company is not a loss. It's a filter.
That company's loss is another company's future gain, {name}.
Rejection is just life's way of saying 'wrong door, try the next one.'
They rejected Einstein too. You're in good company.
Your rejection collection is just your success story's prologue.
I think that you have to believe in your destiny; that you will succeed.
rejected.author: Estée Lauder

rejected.text: It is impossible to live without failing at something.
rejected.author: J.K. Rowling

rejected.text: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
rejected.author: Robert F. Kennedy

rejected.text: Rejection is an opportunity for your selection.
rejected.author: Bernard Branson

rejected.text: A rejection is nothing more than a necessary step in the pursuit of success.
rejected.author: Bo Bennett

rejected.text: Every rejection brings you closer to yes. Math doesn't lie, {name}.
That company's email was rude. Your energy was too good for them anyway.
Imagine working somewhere that didn't want you. Sounds exhausting.
Delete the rejection email. Keep the lesson. Move forward.
The best revenge is massive success. Start plotting, {name}.

interview.text: You've prepared. You're ready. Now go show them why they'd be lucky to have you.
Interviews are just conversations, {name}. You're great at those.
They're not just interviewing you. You're interviewing them too.
Nervousness means you care. Channel it into passion.
You've already survived 100% of your hardest days. This interview is just another one.
Deep breath, {name}. You belong in that room.
The worst they can say is no. And you've survived those before.
Be yourself. The right company wants the real you, not a rehearsed version.
Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgment that something else is more important.
interview.author: Ambrose Redmoon

interview.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
interview.author: Theodore Roosevelt

interview.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
interview.author: Steve Jobs

interview.text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
interview.author: A.A. Milne

interview.text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
interview.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

interview.text: Go in there like you already got the job, {name}.
They need someone great. You ARE someone great. It's a match.
Remember: they called YOU. They already think you're worth talking to.
Picture the interviewer in their underwear. Actually, don't. That's weird. Just be yourself.
The interview is just a conversation where both parties pretend to be normal.
Fun fact: the interviewer is also nervous. They have to pick the right person.
What's the worst that can happen? They say no? You've already survived that.
Plot twist: they're hoping you're 'the one' as much as you are.
You've done harder things than talking about yourself for 30 minutes.
If you can survive group projects in college, you can survive this.
Your anxiety is lying to you. You're prepared. You're capable. You're {name}.
Every expert was once a nervous beginner.
The interview doesn't define you. Your resilience does.
Confidence is silent. Insecurities are loud. Walk in quietly powerful.
You didn't come this far to only come this far, {name}.
This interview is just a conversation. You've had thousands of those.
Channel your inner Beyoncé. Walk in like you own the place.
Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
interview.author: Anaïs Nin

interview.text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
interview.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

interview.text: Fortune favors the bold.
interview.author: Latin Proverb

interview.text: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you stop to look fear in the face.
interview.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

interview.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
interview.author: Mark Twain

interview.text: Smile. It confuses interviewers when you're not nervous.
They put their pants on one leg at a time too, {name}.
Your resume got you here. Your personality seals the deal.
Interviews are like first dates. Just be charming and don't overshare.
You've literally been preparing for this your whole career. You're ready.

imposter.text: Imposter syndrome is just proof that you're pushing yourself, {name}.
You're not a fraud. You're a work in progress. There's a difference.
Everyone feels like an imposter sometimes. Even the people you admire.
Your doubts don't define your abilities.
You earned your skills. You earned your experience. You earned your seat at the table.
The fact that you worry about being good enough proves you care about doing good work.
You don't have to know everything, {name}. You just have to be willing to learn.
Confidence isn't knowing you won't fail. It's knowing you can handle it if you do.
I have written 11 books but each time I think 'Uh-oh, they're going to find out now.'
imposter.author: Maya Angelou

imposter.text: The beauty of the impostor syndrome is you vacillate between extreme egomania and a complete feeling of 'I'm a fraud!'
imposter.author: Tina Fey

imposter.text: I still have a little imposter syndrome. It never goes away.
imposter.author: Sheryl Sandberg

imposter.text: No one knows what they're doing. Some are just better at pretending.
The only difference between you and 'experts' is they started earlier.
Fun fact: most people at work are also Googling things and hoping for the best.
You're not faking it. You're learning it.
Even Einstein had doubts. You're allowed to have them too.
Imposter syndrome means you're in rooms you never thought you'd be in. That's growth.
The people who never doubt themselves are the ones you should worry about.
You belong wherever you are, {name}. You got there for a reason.
Your brain is lying to you. You're more qualified than you think.
Fake it till you make it? Nah. You're already making it.
The fact that you question yourself shows self-awareness. That's a strength.
Plot twist: everyone else in the meeting also feels like they don't belong.
You weren't hired by accident, {name}. Someone saw your potential.
Imposter syndrome is just your comfort zone trying to keep you small.
Your skills are real. Your experience is real. Your achievements are real.
Stop comparing your behind-the-scenes to everyone's highlight reel.
You're not too young, too old, or too inexperienced. You're exactly where you need to be.
The only imposter here is that voice telling you you're not enough.
Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
imposter.author: Suzy Kassem

imposter.text: There is no such thing as a self-made person. Accept help, {name}.
The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment you first find yourself in.
imposter.author: Mark Caine

imposter.text: I am not a has-been. I am a will be.
imposter.author: Lauren Bacall

imposter.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
imposter.author: Oscar Wilde

imposter.text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
imposter.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

imposter.text: That CEO you admire? They also Google 'how to look confident in meetings.'
Your LinkedIn makes you look qualified because you ARE qualified.
The people who seem like they have it together are just better at hiding their chaos.
You're not an imposter, {name}. You're an early-stage expert.
Imposter syndrome is just success in disguise. You're doing something right.

waiting.text: Patience isn't passive waiting. It's active hope.
The silence doesn't mean no, {name}. It just means not yet.
Good things take time. Your opportunity is being prepared.
While you wait, you grow. This isn't wasted time.
Every day you're getting closer, even when it doesn't feel like it.
The wait is part of the journey. Trust the timing.
Something is happening behind the scenes. You just can't see it yet.
Your patience will pay off, {name}. It always does.
Patience is not the ability to wait, but the ability to keep a good attitude while waiting.
waiting.author: Joyce Meyer

waiting.text: Time and patience are the strongest warriors.
Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
waiting.author: A.A. Milne

waiting.text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
waiting.author: Lao Tzu

waiting.text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
waiting.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

waiting.text: HR departments move at the speed of a sloth on sedatives. This is normal.
In the time it takes them to respond, you could learn a new language. Start with patience.
Their 'we'll get back to you soon' and your 'soon' are in different time zones.
Waiting is hard. But you've done harder things, {name}.
The longer the wait, the sweeter the yes.
While you wait for their email, the universe is cooking up something better.
Patience: the art of not throwing your phone at the wall while waiting for emails.
Your inbox will ping when it's meant to. In the meantime, live.
Waiting doesn't mean nothing is happening. It means you can't see what's happening yet.
The best things in life are worth waiting for, {name}.
Maybe they're taking so long because they're crafting the perfect offer.
Your timeline and their timeline don't have to match.
Breathe. The right answer will come at the right time.
Delays are not denials.
What's meant for you won't pass you by. It might just take the scenic route.
The waiting game is just practice for the patience you'll need in your new job.
Every minute of waiting is a minute closer to hearing back.
All things come to those who wait.
waiting.author: Violet Fane

waiting.text: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
waiting.author: Aristotle

waiting.text: One moment of patience may ward off great disaster.
waiting.author: Chinese Proverb

waiting.text: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
waiting.author: Saadi

waiting.text: Genius is nothing but a great aptitude for patience.
waiting.author: George-Louis de Buffon

waiting.text: Still no email? Cool, cool, cool. This is fine. Everything is fine.
Checking your email 47 times won't make them respond faster. But we get it.
The 'we'll be in touch' to actual touch ratio is approximately 1:never. Stay hopeful anyway.
Pro tip: obsessing over your inbox burns more calories than a spin class.
Their delay is not your rejection, {name}. Keep breathing.

ghosted.text: No response is a response. And it says more about them than you.
If they can't respect your time now, imagine working there, {name}.
Being ghosted hurts. But it also saved you from a company with poor communication.
Their silence closed a door. But it didn't lock any of the others.
You deserve a company that values communication. Clearly, this wasn't it.
Ghosting says nothing about your worth. It says everything about their process.
Move on, {name}. Better opportunities don't ghost.
The trash took itself out. Next.
Not getting a response is the universe's way of saying 'Nope, not this one.'
Ghosting is unprofessional. You dodged a bullet of bad company culture.
If they ghost candidates, imagine how they treat employees.
Their loss for not having the decency to respond.
Casper called. He wants his ghosting skills back from that HR department.
At least ghosts in movies have the courtesy to show up.
HR ghosting you is just spooky season all year round.
You've been ghosted by someone who couldn't handle your talent. Their loss.
In a world of ghosters, be someone who follows up. But also, move on.
Plot twist: they're drowning in applications. It's not personal, {name}.
Some companies have the communication skills of a brick. Dodged that.
Ghosting is the company's red flag, not yours.
The universe has a funny way of protecting you from the wrong opportunities.
No response needed. Their silence spoke volumes.
You can't force people to communicate. But you can redirect your energy elsewhere.
Being ghosted is just life's filter for companies that don't deserve you.
If only job applications came with read receipts.
The company that ghosts you isn't the company that deserves you.
Ghosting: when even 'no' is too much effort for them.
You didn't lose an opportunity. You gained information about their culture.
The right company will never leave you wondering, {name}.
Their ghosting is just the universe's way of keeping your calendar free for better things.
When people show you who they are, believe them the first time.
ghosted.author: Maya Angelou

ghosted.text: Silence is the most powerful scream.
Not everyone deserves to know what you bring to the table.
The energy you would have wasted there is now free for something better.
Let it go. Frozen had a point.
Plot twist: their ATS ate your email. Also plot twist: doesn't matter, move on.
Ghosting is so 2010. These companies need to update their manners.
You can't haunt someone who's already moved on, {name}.
Their inbox might be a mess. Your worth isn't.
The audacity of ghosting someone as talented as you. Unbelievable.

another_candidate.text: They chose someone else. That doesn't mean they chose someone better.
You were good enough to be a finalist, {name}. That's not nothing.
The right fit goes both ways. Maybe this wasn't yours.
Another candidate got this one. You'll get the next one.
Second place in one race is still a strong runner.
They made their choice. Now you're free to find the company that chooses you.
Plot twist: the job you actually want hasn't even posted yet.
Their 'another candidate' email is just your 'keep going' signal, {name}.
Sometimes the 'better fit' is just someone who asked for less money. That's not about you.
The other candidate might have had an inside connection. Doesn't mean you weren't great.
They chose differently. That's not the same as choosing better.
Every closed door is just pointing you to the open one.
You made it to the final round. Most people didn't even get a call.
The right job won't just choose you. It will celebrate finding you.
Rejection from one is just redirection to another, {name}.
They went with someone else. Cool. Someone else will go with you.
The other candidate's win isn't your loss. Different paths, different destinations.
Maybe you were overqualified. Maybe they couldn't afford you. Who knows.
One door closes, another opens. And sometimes, it's a better door.
Getting close means you're doing something right.
That 'unfortunately' email is just a 'fortunately' in disguise.
You'll look back at this and laugh from your dream job.
The company that picks you won't have to think twice about it.
Not every opportunity is YOUR opportunity. And that's okay.
Somewhere, there's a company that needs exactly what you bring.
Their loss, {name}. Their absolute loss.
The 'other candidate' probably isn't even that great. They just interviewed first.
Fun fact: 'we went with another candidate' often means 'our budget got cut.'
The right match is out there. This just wasn't it.
Take a breath. Eat some chocolate. Apply to the next one.
When one door of happiness closes, another opens.
another_candidate.author: Helen Keller

another_candidate.text: What is meant for you will not pass you by.
another_candidate.author: Arabic Proverb

another_candidate.text: Every adversity carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
another_candidate.author: Napoleon Hill

another_candidate.text: The wound is the place where the light enters you.
another_candidate.author: Rumi

another_candidate.text: New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings.
another_candidate.author: Lao Tzu

another_candidate.text: They chose that person. But you're still the main character in your story, {name}.
The universe has better taste than that hiring manager.
Their loss is so big, it needs its own zip code.
You're not plan B. The right company will make you plan A.
That other candidate better be amazing, because they missed out on YOU.

burnout.text: It's okay to pause, {name}. You can't pour from an empty cup.
Burnout is real. Take a break. The job posts will still be there tomorrow.
You're not lazy. You're exhausted. There's a difference.
Rest isn't giving up. It's gearing up.
One application a day is still progress, {name}.
Your mental health matters more than any job listing.
It's a marathon, not a sprint. Pace yourself.
Step away from the laptop. Go outside. The jobs aren't going anywhere.
You've sent enough applications today. Netflix is calling.
Burning out won't get you hired faster. Rest is part of the strategy.
Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.
burnout.author: Anne Lamott

burnout.text: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself.
burnout.author: Ralph Marston

burnout.text: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a beautiful crop.
burnout.author: Ovid

burnout.text: You can't do a good job if your job is all you do.
Hustle culture is a scam. Rest is revolutionary.
Your worth isn't measured in applications sent per day.
Job searching is emotionally exhausting. Give yourself grace, {name}.
Take a nap. Seriously. Naps are underrated.
The job market will survive without you for one day. Take a break.
You've been job searching in the hardest market in years. Cut yourself some slack.
Close LinkedIn. Open something that brings you joy.
Burnout is your body's way of saying 'enough.' Listen to it.
You're not a machine. You need rest to function.
Taking breaks makes you more productive, not less.
The best ideas come after rest. Including 'what job do I actually want?'
It's okay to not be okay, {name}. Job searching is hard.
Permission granted to do absolutely nothing today.
You've been fighting. Now rest. Tomorrow, fight again.
Even superheroes take breaks between saving the world.
Your couch misses you. The applications can wait.
Self-care is not selfish. You cannot serve from an empty vessel.
burnout.author: Eleanor Brownn

burnout.text: There is virtue in work and there is virtue in rest. Use both and overlook neither.
burnout.author: Alan Cohen

burnout.text: Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax.
burnout.author: Mark Black

burnout.text: The time to relax is when you don't have time for it.
burnout.author: Sydney J. Harris

burnout.text: Your calm mind is the ultimate weapon against your challenges.
burnout.author: Bryant McGill

burnout.text: Your brain is fried. Feed it ice cream and try again tomorrow, {name}.
Job boards will still be there after your walk. Go touch grass.
You've earned a break. Take it before your body takes it for you.
Pressing pause is not the same as giving up. It's strategic recovery.
Even your phone needs to recharge. So do you.

boost.text: You're doing better than you think, {name}.
Job searching is a job in itself. You're working hard.
Every application is a step forward, even if it doesn't feel like it.
Your worth isn't measured by your employment status.
This chapter is hard. But it's still just a chapter.
You've got skills, experience, and determination. That's a powerful combination.
Take a break if you need one, {name}. Rest is productive too.
The right opportunity is looking for someone exactly like you.
You're not starting over. You're starting fresh.
Keep going. Your future self will thank you.
Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.
You are more resilient than you know.
The best is yet to come.
Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think.
boost.author: A.A. Milne

boost.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
boost.author: Albert Einstein

boost.text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
boost.author: Tony Robbins

boost.text: You are never too old to set another goal or dream a new dream.
boost.author: C.S. Lewis

boost.text: What we think, we become.
boost.author: Buddha

boost.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
boost.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

boost.text: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world throws at you.
boost.author: Brian Tracy

boost.text: Your vibe attracts your tribe. And your next employer.
Plot twist: you're about to land something amazing, {name}.
You woke up today. That's a win. Everything else is extra.
Someone out there needs exactly what you offer. Keep showing up.
You're one application away from changing your life.
Your journey is valid. Your struggle is valid. Your comeback is coming.
Diamonds are made under pressure. So are job seekers.
Today might be hard, but you're harder, {name}.
You've survived 100% of your worst days. This one's no different.
Something good is coming. You can feel it. Trust that feeling.
Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
boost.author: William James

boost.text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
boost.author: Nelson Mandela

boost.text: You are enough just as you are.
boost.author: Meghan Markle

boost.text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
boost.author: C.S. Lewis

boost.text: The struggle you're in today is developing the strength you need tomorrow.
You're literally too talented to not get hired. The math isn't mathing yet, but it will.
Main character energy, {name}. That's what you have.
Your next chapter is going to be so good. Keep turning pages.
Somewhere, a hiring manager is about to have a great day because of you.
You've got this. And if you don't, you'll figure it out. You always do.
